intro: Tumion grande, commonly known as the large tumion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a robust, upright stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and produce small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Tumion grande is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and resilience in various soil conditions.
